import React, { useEffect, useState, Fragment } from "react"; import { useParams } from "react-router-dom"; import dayjs from 'dayjs'; import { camera, fb, file2, fileIcon, headphone, instra, likeIcon, ln, lock, starIcon, target, twitter, user, user2, ux, web, yt, rc1, rc2, rc3, clockIcon, cmnt1, cmnt2, } from "../constant/images"; import { Disclosure, Tab } from "@headlessui/react"; const CourseDetails = () => { const { id } = useParams(); // Extract ID from URL const [course, setCourse] = useState([]); const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true); const [error, setError] = useState(null); useEffect(() => { const fetchCourseDetails = async () => { try { const response = await fetch(`http://localhost:3000/api/courses/${id}`); if (!response.ok) { throw new Error("Failed to fetch course details"); } const data = await response.json(); console.log(data); setCourse(data.course); setLoading(false); } catch (err) { setError(err.message); setLoading(false); } }; fetchCourseDetails(); }, [id]); if (loading) return
Loading course details...
; if (error) return
Error: {error}
; return (
{course.category?.name}

{course.title || "Untitled Course"}

Last Update: {course.updatedAt ? dayjs(course.updatedAt).format('MMMM DD, YYYY') : 'N/A'}
{["OverView", "Instructor"].map( (item, index) => ( selected ? "active" : null } > {item} ) )}
